page.title: 12News Items.
page.content:
One of the main concerns in the local press has been unemployment.The theme has been constantly one of a lack of jobs. On May 16th the Winsford Chronicle carried a story under the headline 'Animal Cruelty Goes Up As Jobs Are Lost.'An RSPCA spokesman claimed that unemployed people in Winsford were venting there spite on their pets. Another story concerned an MSC survey on jobs.A third story offered hope as a local firm V.G.Isotopes planned expansion over the next 2 years. However many other stories spoke of contraction and redundacies.
Another major concern has been vandalism.Plans to 're-vamp'the shopping centre by covering it with a glass roof have been threatened by worries about further vandalism to the
